title: I flamed and i got 10 games strict
body: I can say,Riot,you have wrong ban system.When JUNGLE IRELIA trolls game and wont gank anybody,watches us die in 3v2,5v4 fights,she does not get strict or ban.But when i type her ''You are retarded,dont troll my game'' I get strict???????Riot is worst company ever,everything they have good is player support.You should be very ashamed Riot, but that are Europeans and Americas,never seen serbian company ever do that.For toxicity should not be punishment,they can easly mute me if i tilt them,but how will i kick them out of my game so they don't troll my game????Good job Rito.Type in comments why you don't agree with me

replies.body: Cant tell if shitpost or just angry troll..
This isnt angry,Jungle trolls my game,i flame her,i got strict,she gets nothing.is that okey?

Someone else's behavior does not excuse your own.

You break the rules, you face the consequences.

That's why riot is worst thing ever made......... DotA 2 is better. 
Also can i get answer, why Irelia didnt get strict or ban, so i did? She trolled

For starters, because you don't get chat restrictions for trolling.

Secondly, because gameplay toxicity is much harder to detect than verbal.

Besides that, it really doesn't look like Irelia was trolling. She has a KDA I would expect for losing against a damage heavy team, she isn't building any trollish items, and she even has a greater KP than you do.

So I'm disinclined to believe you that she was trolling.

To add onto what Krol Wilk Sam said it's not just Riot who has this policy as many real life establishments and even companies like Blizzard have this policy as well where if multiple people act up they'll all usually be punished accordingly.

Also, the mute button is meant to be a bandaid solution to help prevent further verbal harassment but does not excuse the harassment that's already happened.

If you disagree with the rules then fine, feel free to find another game with less strict rules regarding player behavior, but keep in mind that this is the lightest punishment given out so you still have plenty of opportunities to learn from this and improve your behavior if you decide to continue playing League.
